p: Identifying chemotypes can help clarify the distribution and evolution of this species [ 17], as well as determine economically important species due to high prevalences and incidence of compounds, such as sesquiterpene α-bisabolol (approximately 93.7%), in specific regions. This sesquiterpene was only observed in the specimens from the São Paulo region, and is used for biotechnological purposes, as the essential oil from Cordia verbenacea, which is used to produce a phytotherapeutic topical anti-inflammatory called Acheflan ® due to its active compound α-humulene (5 mg of the essential oil is equivalent to 0.130 mg of alpha-humulene in cream formulation).
